```{r}
my_data <- read.csv("/Users/camerondiehl/downloads/QBS103_GSE157103_genes.csv")
print(my_data)
```

```{r}
metadata <- read.csv("/Users/camerondiehl/downloads/QBS103_GSE157103_series_matrix-1.csv")
print(metadata)
```

```{r}
# Rename gene name column, by overwriting my_data (asked ChatGPT how to properly do this)
my_data <- my_data %>%
  rename(Gene = X)

# Reshape from wide to long format
long_expr <- my_data %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = -Gene,                    # Keep 'Gene' column fixed
    names_to = "participant_id",     # New column for participant/sample names
    values_to = "Expression"         # New column for gene expression values
  )
```



```{r}
combined <- left_join(long_expr, metadata, by = "participant_id")
combined <- combined %>%
  drop_na()
print(combined)
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)

long_expr <- my_data %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = -X,                      
    names_to = "participant_id",   
    values_to = "Expression"         
  )
```

```{r}
combined <- left_join(long_expr, metadata, by = "participant_id")
print(combined)
```
